profile_positions.title: Assistant Plant Launch Operations Manager (APLOM) | TRACK Program

profile_positions.location: Gravataí, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
profile_positions.title: Production Supervisor (Group Leader) | TRACK Program

profile_positions.description:
Intern in the Technical Management department which is responsible of Planning, Execution and Monitoring & Control of the projects developed by the company.

-During my Internship I developed a project focused on the Monitoring & Control of the projects that are being carried out, applying Earned Value Management (EVM) and its respective indicators (CPI-SPI- EAC-ETC) which enables the team to incorporate an efficient use of time (Schedule) and resources (Costs) reducing the probabilities of incurring in cost overruns and inefficiencies.

Also responsible of:

•Analysis of savings to justify the investment projects
•Analyse possible alternatives that could meet the client's requirements.
•Update and integrate schedules of the suppliers involved in the projects.
profile_positions.title: Engineering Intern

profile_positions.description:
-During my internship I lead the project of standardization of the coating properties (Hardness & Crown) of the embossing process rolls, reducing quality issues in the final product and increasing the lifespan of the rolls.

-For the characterization of the materials, the following tests were carried out with their respective reports:
1. Tensile module Test
2. Compression test
3. DSC
4. TGA

-This tests were performed in order to verify if the properties of the materials provided by the suppliers meet the centerlines that are found in the literature available of the process. This information was used to solve some quality problems by sharing it with the suppliers to ensure that they provide rolls that meet the properties required by the process.
profile_positions.title: Undergraduate Intern

company.name: General Motors
company.description:
General Motors’ vision is to create a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, and we have committed ourselves to leading the way toward this future. Today, we are in the midst of a transportation revolution, and we have the ambition, the talent and the technology to realize the safer, better and more sustainable world we want. As an open, inclusive company, we’re also creating an environment where everyone feels welcomed and valued for who they are. One team, where all ideas are considered and heard, where everyone can contribute to their fullest potential, with a culture based in respect, integrity, accountability and equality. Our team brings wide-ranging perspectives and experiences to solving the complex transportation challenges of today and tomorrow.
